the audited financial statements of the bank to the 27th ordinary annual general meeting of shareholders for the fiscal year 202223 that ended june 30 , 2023. fiscal year 202223 featured a set of socioeconomic and geopolitical challenges in the global economy with notable repercussions on the financial industry . the global economic activity that demonstrated some resilience remained weak by historical standards owing mainly to the rise in central banks policy rates in a bid to fight inflation , which continued to weigh on economic activity worldwide imf weo update , july 2023. the policy tightening by central banks in response to inflation has brought about high economic costs , such as high borrowing costs for emerging and developing economies , constraining room for priority investments , and raising the risk of debt distress . as a result , output losses remained large and the global economic growth rate is believed to have slowed down to 3.0 in 2023 from 3.5 in 2022. the ethiopian economy also faced a number of interlocking challenges during the year . the economy has been suffering from ongoing conflicts with impact on normal economic operations and development . on top of the security challenges , macroeconomic imbalances such as persistent inflation and foreign exchange shortage , and food insecurity and drought prevalence have also added to the economys ailments . the unabated inflationary pressure has exacerbated cost of doing business affecting the industry . nevertheless , according to imfs report of april 2023 , the economy managed to register a positive economic growth estimated to be 6.1 during fy 202223. ethiopia has begun to implement a series of economic reforms and took steps to give impetus to digital economy which entailed a number of policy and regulatory changes . such changes include the provision of license to non- bank financial service provider institutions to engage in payment and other financial services such as telcos and payment instrument issuers . other reform steps of great significance for the financial industry as well as the economy , taken during the year , include the enactment of policy direction for the opening up of the banking business for foreign investors and steps for the establishment of a functioning capital market . numerous policy changes were also introduced during the year by the government , with the view of setting forth prudential regulation and monetary management , such as requirements of banks to purchase government treasury bonds , and amendment to payment system proclamation . all these developments present both

and principal and the banks previous experience of similar forbearance action . as part of this process , the bank evaluates the borrowers payment performance against the modified contractual terms default lgd and exposure at default ead . ecl for exposures in stage 1 is calculated by multiplying the 12-month pd by lgd and ead . lifetime ecl is calculated by multiplying the lifetime pd by lgd and ead . the methodology of estimating pds is discussed above under the heading generating the term structure of pd . lgd is the magnitude of the likely loss if there is a default . the bank estimates lgd parameters based on the history of recovery rates of claims against defaulted counterparties . the lgd models consider the structure , collateral , seniority of the claim , counterparty industry and recoverycosts of any collateral that is integral to the financial asset . ead represents the expected exposure in the event of a default . the bank derives the ead from the current exposure to the counterparty and potential changes to the current amount allowed under the contract and arising from amortisation . the ead of a financial asset is its gross carrying amount at the time of default . for lending commitments , the eads are potential future amounts that may be drawn under the contract , which are estimated based on historical observations and forward-looking
